definition: system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Today, millstones of the same shape are still being used.
sentences.chinese: 至今同一形制的磨盤還在使用。

sentences.english: In the later stage of Shang dynasty and later, the structure was convergent.
sentences.chinese: 商晚期後，形制趨同，體現了禮制的規範與完善。

sentences.english: The style is four columns, three gates, three brims , five water dypasses in this wooden-like stone archway.
sentences.chinese: 該坊形制爲四柱三門三重檐五滴水仿木青石雕花牌坊。

sentences.english: The shape system of Chu-Jiu is simple, which is major cereal husking tool.
sentences.chinese: 杵臼形制簡單，是主要的穀物脫殼工具。

sentences.english: He also suggested another viewpoint on the formation of pre-historic ancient city ruins.
sentences.chinese: 他還對史前城址的形制演變提出了看法。

definition: to dig up/to appear in an excavation/unearthed/to come up out of the ground
according to a pattern/regular/orderly/structured/neat and tidy
bronze implement/refers to ancient bronze artifacts, from c. 2,000 BC
